conclusion: Both objects start from the same location and move in the same direction.
The diagram shows the velocity of both objects as a function of time.
The area under each velocity-time curve represents the displacement.
Object A starts with a velocity that decreases over time, then increases.
Object B starts with a lower velocity, increases, and intersects with Object Aâ€™s curve.
The two objects meet when their displacements are equal, which occurs when the areas under their velocity-time curves are equal.
From t1 to t3, Object A has a larger area under its curve than Object B.
At t3, the areas under the curves of both objects become equal.
The two objects meet at time t3, as this is when their displacements are equal.
